paper_metadata.title: Rapid Energy Consumption Modelling for CNC Based Milling Process

machine_info.material_processed: S50C carbon steel (610 MPa tensile strength, 179 HB hardness)

energy_data.power_consumption: Standby power: 285-887 W across 10 machines, Cutting power: P_cutting = 0.037n^0.222 v_f^0.759 a_p^0.9 a_e^1.109
energy_data.measurement_method: Magnetic voltage sensors (HIOKI 9804-01) + current transducers (CYBER HCP8150), NI data acquisition at 12800 Hz sampling

other_kpis: modelling_time: 30 minutes total (15 minutes sensor installation)

additional_notes: Novel rapid modelling approach using magnetic sensors that require no machine modification. Uses modified Taguchi method to reduce required experiments. NC code parameter extraction automated via Python. Open-source data and code available on GitHub. Validated on 10 different CNC milling machines with varying specifications.
